result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J Knotek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: First 6 Months as Straight time. Balance may be served with Huber. Release for work, work search and treatment if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation, within the first 10 months. Defendant may complete community service at the rate of $25.00 per hour towards payment of costs. Agent to make any financial adjustments.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with the ARC Program. Follow through with other programs offering assistance. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Work on obtaining a valid driver's license. Maintain/obtain employment or volunteer work or other activity within 30 days of release. Become involved with AA and maintain contact with a sponsor. Work with St. Vincent De Paul with assistance living in the community. No new law violations. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 24 days were granted for condition time.
